**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 217 Some NPCs, such as the [beast tamer](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3576), the [orc gamekeeper](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3663), and the [pack leader](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3581), take on and train animal companions to help them with their endeavors. The creatures from _Monster Core_ listed below work well in this role. Unlike a PC's animal companion, an NPC's animal companion has the standard number of actions, uses its normal stat block, and counts toward the encounter's XP budget normally. Several new creatures suitable for animal companions are presented beginning on page 218. You can use the [weak](/Rules.aspx?ID=791) and [elite](/Rules.aspx?ID=790) adjustments to scale their level to be appropriate for an encounter's budget. **Level -1**: [compsognathus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2914), [eagle](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2968), [flash beetle](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2852), [giant centipede](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2875), [giant rat](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3162), [guard dog](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2924), [viper](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3200)
**Level 0**: [bottlenose dolphin](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2926), [riding dog](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2925)
**Level 1**: [electric eel](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2970), [giant gecko](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3087), [goblin dog](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3028), [hippocampus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3050), [hunting spider](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3207), [hyena](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3065), [python](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3201), [riding dog](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2925), [riding horse](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3058), [velociraptor](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2915), [war pony](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3059), [wolf](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3241)
**Level 2**: [boar](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2854), [crocodile](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2887), [deinonychus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2916), [giant ant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2824), [giant monitor lizard](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3088), [giant viper](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3202), [hippogriff](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3052), [leopard](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2865), [pteranodon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3151), [slurk](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3199), [war horse](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3060)
**Level 3**: [ankhrav](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2822), [dire wolf](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3242), [giant mantis](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3094), [giant scorpion](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3175), [giant wasp](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3233), [gorilla](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2827), [grizzly bear](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2850), [hell hound](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3047), [hyaenodon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3066), [lion](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2866), [pachycephalosaurus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2917), [snapping flytrap](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2999)
**Level 4**: [daeodon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2855), [giant stag beetle](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2853), [griffon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3034), [rhinoceros](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3168), [tiger](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2867)
**Level 5**: [giant frilled lizard](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3089), [giant moray eel](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2971)
**Level 6**: [cave bear](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2851), [giant tarantula](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3208), [smilodon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2868), [woolly rhinoceros](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3169)
**Level 8**: [krooth](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3076)
**Level 9**: [greater hell hound](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3048)
**Level 10**: [gezullon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2912)
Riding Animal Companions An NPC can ride a creature that works alongside them as long as the creature is at least one size larger than the rider. Generally, a creature that is carrying a rider can use only its land Speed and can't grant its support benefit. However, certain creatures that have been trained to be ridden, such as horses and riding drakes, ignores those restrictions.
